image.altText: Close-up photo of a large ship in port.

props.synopsis: The Scottish government denies it is planning to use a new Spirit of Tasmania ferry to house Ukrainian refugees. It comes after speculation it was in "advanced negotiations" to do so.

title.children: 'Not true': Scottish government denies refugee plan for Spirit of Tasmania ferry

image.altText: Greg Farrell in front of Wrest Point Casino

props.synopsis: Tasmania has a long and complex history with gambling. Its attempt to introduce mandatory pre-commitment cards for poker machines was never going to be easy — and letters and emails reveal how it was rapidly reconsidered.

title.children: The pokies giant, the ministers, the reports, and how reform was scaled back

image.altText: A mum and three daughters looking at records in a store

props.synopsis: Lauren was on a mission to listen to more music by women, and so a new record store was born — one where her three daughters could also work.

title.children: A record shop with a twist: You'll only find female artists here

image.altText: A black building with a big red 7 logo

props.synopsis: The company which has launched an Australian version of the US right-wing streaming channel Newsmax says its latest acquisition, which includes a raft of TV stations, will be run separately to that operation.

title.children: Conservative news operator takes over 7 Tasmania, other television assets

image.altText: A kelpie collie dog, with brown fur in two shades and white patches sitting on couch next to blurred owner in background.

props.synopsis: Two-thirds of Australian households have a pet, but in some states body corporates can ban even home owners from keeping animals. With high-density housing on the rise, strata industry leaders and pet owners are advocating for change.

title.children: In four Australian jurisdictions, body corporates are allowed to ban pets

image.altText: Our AI future

props.synopsis: The future rarely unfolds like we expect. Although Hollywood has given us plenty of technological tropes to worry about, our AI future is much more mundane and much more insidious.

title.children: Our AI future isn't conscious robots with lethal ambition. It might be worse

image.altText: Anthony Albanese at Lunar New Year celebrations. He stands in front of a Chinese dragon

props.synopsis: Of the 20 electorates considered in play this election, at least half of them have a Chinese-Australian population that is well above the national average

title.children: Politicians turn to Little Red Book to sway voters who could decide election

image.altText: chairman mao on a banknote

props.synopsis: Workers speak out about the impact of wage cuts in the finance sector in China, while simultaneous hikes to public sector pay packets leaves many people confused.

title.children: Workers stressed, confused as China cuts salaries in finance sector

image.altText: A chef bends over near a carton of eggs

props.synopsis: The ABC has analysed egg price data and the factors driving the cost increase, as bird flu continues to wreak havoc on supply.

title.children: Why Australian egg prices have hit a 15-year high

image.altText: Melissa Wu story lead image

props.synopsis: Melissa Wu had an early start to her sporting career and credited her hard work ethic to the cultural values embedded through her Chinese lineage.

title.children: Chinese heritage is Olympian Melissa Wu's 'secret weapon'

image.altText: A human skull resting on a large fabric cloth.

props.synopsis: In the 1800s a Russian explorer took 16 human skulls from Papua New Guinea to prove a theory. Now they've finally been returned home.

title.children: Unlikely return of long lost skulls sparks celebration in PNG

image.altText: Silver man at Mardi Gras 010325

props.synopsis: Thousands of people lined Oxford Street, Flinders Parade and Anzac Parade in Darlinghurst for Sydney's 'free to be' Mardi Gras.

title.children: Oxford Street abuzz for Mardi Gras with disco balls, glitter but no Kylie

image.altText: A large wave crashing on rocks.

props.synopsis: Tropical Cyclone Alfred is lashing the Queensland coast with damaging winds and causing significant coastal erosion.

title.children: Powerful seas cause erosion as Cyclone Alfred lingers off Queensland

image.altText: Hard Quiz host Tom Gleeson with his eyebrows raised and mouth open. The Hard Quiz logo is in the top right corner

props.synopsis: I must say, I do admire your courage in coming back this week for another try. Just kidding, I never feel that way.

title.children: Talk a big quiz game? It's time to play, HARD!

image.altText: Australian players around their captain, who is lifting a trophy, as confetti falls

props.synopsis: The Young Socceroos have battled their way to glory in the Under-20 Asian Cup, beating Saudi Arabia in a penalty shootout in the final on a breakthrough day for Australian soccer.

title.children: Young Socceroos make history with first Asian Cup triumph

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: A close-up of a Buddhist stone statue with closed eyes and a neutral, peaceful expression on its face.

props.synopsis: Statues and hundreds of culturally significant artefacts have been returned to Indonesia by the Dutch, but with close to 30 museum theft cases in recent decades authorities move to ensure these don't end up in an illegal private collection.

title.children: Indonesia got some treasures back, but can it protect them?

image.altText: A lady, Emma Young, smiling at the camera for a photo

props.synopsis: Data shows a one-person household can spend $2,835 per month on living costs compared to couples who spend a combined $4,118 per month, or $2,059 per person.

title.children: The singles tax shows the 'cold hard costs' of flying solo

image.altText: A photo of Andi in jeans, wearing an Akubra hat, and holding a rifle, in front of a jeep.

props.synopsis: Ecologists say regular culls are necessary to protect vegetation and other native animals, as well as the animal welfare of the kangaroos themselves.

title.children: A kangaroo 'crash' is coming — should they be shot before they starve?

image.altText: Gene Hackman at the Golden Globes in 2003, smiling on the red carpet

props.synopsis: Gene Hackman and Betsy Arakawa's initial autopsies finds the pair suffered no external trauma and tested negative for carbon monoxide poisoning.

title.children: Hackman's pacemaker stopped nine days before discovery, sheriff says

image.altText: The outside of a commercial building with Medicare Urgent Care Clinic signage

props.synopsis: Labor is promising to expand the existing 87-clinic network if re-elected, with this $644 million promise coming on top of the $8.5 billion pledged last weekend to lift bulk-billing rates.

title.children: Labor commits to opening 50 new urgent care clinics

image.altText: An elderly man in white clothing and a skull cap gestures as he speaks into a silver microphone.

props.synopsis: In an update on Saturday, the Vatican says the 88-year-old pope didn't have any further respiratory crises overnight, following a coughing fit on Friday during which he inhaled vomit.

title.children: Pope Francis drinking coffee, resting after breathing incident, Vatican says

image.altText: Jos Buttler of England looks dejected as he leaves the field

props.synopsis: England will have to rebuild and regain their confidence in the 50-over format after a dismal Champions Trophy campaign, outgoing captain Jos Buttler says.

title.children: England's dismal Champions Trophy ends with another heavy defeat

image.altText: A shot of two cricketers wearing green. One, on the left holds a cricket bat and one on the right has arms raised

props.synopsis: Akanksha Swarup took 18 wickets in an afternoon. She's a member of a unique cricket club built for players with an intellectual impairment.

title.children: 'Uncoachable' coaches changing the face of weekend cricket

image.altText: Woman in bright red dress sits on fluffy white couch smiling widely. A painting is above her head behind her.

props.synopsis: From repurposed quilt covers and op-shop treasures to hemp and cactus leather, sustainable fashion is proudly showing off at this year's Melbourne Fashion Festival.

title.children: Most of us wear less than half our wardrobe: This runway wants to fix that

image.altText: Blister pack of contraceptive pills on a pink and blue background.

props.synopsis: New subsidies are rolling out from March but what does this mean for women who have experienced unwanted side effects?

title.children: How two women faced unexpected health challenges on birth control

image.altText: Libby Mettam and Thomas Brough walk side-by-side while smiling outside the health campus

props.synopsis: WA Liberal leader Libby Mettam has ruled out a review of abortion laws while distancing herself from comments made by Albany candidate Thomas Brough, who has also linked the LGBTQIA+ community with paedophiles.

title.children: WA Liberals face more candidate controversy amid call to review abortion laws

image.altText: Hamas militants with faces covered pointing guns in air.

props.synopsis: Hamas says it has rejected an Israeli proposal to extend phase one of the ceasefire deal in Gaza, throwing the Middle East peace process into uncertainty just hours before the first stage of the agreement is set to expire.

title.children: Israel-Hamas ceasefire in peril as first phase set to expire

image.altText: Fresh vegetables and fruits against junk food, fast food on black background

props.synopsis: Thirty years after dietitians Elyse Resch and Evelyn Tribole released an anti-diet culture book, their bold approach is being embraced online. But what exactly is intuitive eating?

title.children: What does TikTok get right and wrong about intuitive eating?

image.altText: Kamagra, Cenforce-D and other male enhances within a cabinet

props.synopsis: Adult store chain Sexyland is selling multiple sexual performance drugs over the counter at several of its shops in Victoria, despite them not being approved by Australian authorities.

title.children: Sexyland selling unapproved sex performance drugs in Victorian stores

image.altText: The outside of a historical pub named THE PYRMONT BRIDGE HOTEL  on a clear sunny day

props.synopsis: Vishal Gurung faced court in January after being charged with assaulting and sexually touching a woman, but failed to attend his next court date days later.

title.children: Man on the run after alleged assault of woman at Sydney bar

image.altText: A 10-year-old boy in a Ferrari cap stands on a karting track with his arms crossed.

props.synopsis: While other Year 5 students are playing football or reading a book, Canberran Lazarus Añonuevo is turning heads on go-karting circuits around Australia and overseas in his pursuit to become a Formula One driver.

title.children: Ten-year-old Lazarus is already driving over 100kmh to follow his F1 dreams

image.altText: A woman bends over a table with rubber gloves testing a substance.

props.synopsis: Wollongong's Yours and Owls Festival is hosting New South Wales' first pill testing trial and the first in Australia to be led by a government.

title.children: Inside Australia's first government-led pill testing trial

image.altText: couple drinking coffee at a cafe

props.synopsis: With external stresses such as cost of living and the housing crisis, many people might be feeling reluctant to make long-term plans, experts say.

title.children: Why some of us find talking about the future overwhelming
